import React from 'react'; import './App.css'; import { Title, Subtitle, Text, CoverText, Signature, Iconic } from './components/Text/Text'; import { MenuBar, MenuBarItem } from './components/MenuBar/MenuBar'; import { Image, ImageRow } from './components/Image/Image'; import { ImageGallery } from './components/ImageGallery/ImageGallery'; import { Hexagon } from './components/Hexagon/Hexagon'; function App() { return (
<Text text="My biggest strength is that I am like a swiss army knife when it comes to UX. I have a lot of experince in developing prototypes, designing wireframes, creating studies, analysing systems, articulating text... The list goes on and on."/> </div> <ImageGallery/> </div> <div id="ux" className="Section"> <div position="paragraph" className="Container"> <Title text="why ux?"/> <Text size="small" text="UX is not just about cool graphics and front-end design. It's about fully understanding your users and their needs, you are able to provide them with a much more satisfying experience. But equally important, you need a mutual understanding internally in the developer team, as misunderstandings often are the reason for bad user experiences."/> <ImageRow></ImageRow> </div> </div> <div id="projects" className="Section"> <div position="paragraph" className="Container"> <Title text="projects"/> <Text size="small" text="I have been working on a lot of exiting projects as a UX Designer. Some of them are from my time as a student at the university, and some of them are for huge companies, such as Nilfisk. They all gave me a lot of experience."/> <Hexagon></Hexagon> </div> </div> <div id="contact" className="Section"> <div position="paragraph" className="Container"> <Title text="contact"/> <Text size="small" text="I am always looking for new and exiting challenges, so if you are developing a product or service, and you want satisfied users, don’t hessitate to contact me."/> <Text text="Let’s dicuss how a good user experience can contribute to your project."/> </div> </div> <div id="footer" className="Section"></div> </div> ); } export default App;
